motivation: for the invention of an apparatus to produce extremely high pressures, and for the discoveries he made therewith in the field of high pressure physics.

name: Wolfgang Pauli
affiliation: Princeton University, Princeton, NJ, USA
motivation: for the discovery of the Exclusion Principle, also called the Pauli Principle.

name: Isidor Isaac Rabi
affiliation: Columbia University, New York, NY, USA
motivation: for his resonance method for recording the magnetic properties of atomic nuclei.

name: Otto Stern
affiliation: Carnegie Institute of Technology, Pittsburgh, PA, USA
motivation: for his contribution to the development of the molecular ray method and his discovery of the magnetic moment of the proton.
comment: Otto Stern received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1944.

name: Ernest Orlando Lawrence
affiliation: University of California, Berkeley, CA, USA
motivation: for the invention and development of the cyclotron and for results obtained with it, especially with regard to artificial radioactive elements.

name: Enrico Fermi
affiliation: Rome University, Rome, Italy
motivation: for his demonstrations of the existence of new radioactive elements produced by neutron irradiation, and for his related discovery of nuclear reactions brought about by slow neutrons.

name: Clinton Joseph Davisson
affiliation: Bell Telephone Laboratories, New York, NY, USA
motivation: for their experimental discovery of the diffraction of electrons by crystals.

name: George Paget Thomson
affiliation: London University, London, United Kingdom
motivation: for their experimental discovery of the diffraction of electrons by crystals.

name: Victor Franz Hess
affiliation: Innsbruck University, Innsbruck, Austria
motivation: for his discovery of cosmic radiation.

name: Carl David Anderson
affiliation: California Institute of Technology (Caltech), Pasadena, CA, USA
motivation: for his discovery of the positron.

name: James Chadwick
affiliation: Liverpool University, Liverpool, United Kingdom
motivation: for the discovery of the neutron.

name: Erwin Schrödinger
affiliation: Berlin University, Berlin, Germany
motivation: for the discovery of new productive forms of atomic theory.

name: Paul Adrien Maurice Dirac
affiliation: University of Cambridge, Cambridge, United Kingdom
motivation: for the discovery of new productive forms of atomic theory.

name: Werner Karl Heisenberg
affiliation: Leipzig University, Leipzig, Germany
motivation: for the creation of quantum mechanics, the application of which has, inter alia, led to the discovery of the allotropic forms of hydrogen.
comment: Werner Heisenberg received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1933.

name: Sir Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman
affiliation: Calcutta University, Calcutta, India
motivation: for his work on the scattering of light and for the discovery of the effect named after him.

name: Prince Louis-Victor Pierre Raymond de Broglie
affiliation: Sorbonne University, Institut Henri Poincaré, Paris, France
motivation: for his discovery of the wave nature of electrons.

name: Owen Willans Richardson
affiliation: London University, London, United Kingdom
motivation: for his work on the thermionic phenomenon and especially for the discovery of the law named after him.
comment: Owen Willans Richardson received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1929.

name: Arthur Holly Compton
affiliation: University of Chicago, Chicago, IL, USA
motivation: for his discovery of the effect named after him.

name: Charles Thomson Rees Wilson
affiliation: University of Cambridge, Cambridge, United Kingdom
motivation: for his method of making the paths of electrically charged particles visible by condensation of vapour.

name: Jean Baptiste Perrin
affiliation: Sorbonne University, Paris, France
motivation: for his work on the discontinuous structure of matter, and especially for his discovery of sedimentation equilibrium.

name: James Franck
affiliation: Goettingen University, Göttingen, Germany
motivation: for their discovery of the laws governing the impact of an electron upon an atom.
comment: James Franck and Gustav Hertz received their Nobel Prize one year later, in 1926.

name: Gustav Ludwig Hertz
affiliation: Halle University, Halle, Germany
motivation: for their discovery of the laws governing the impact of an electron upon an atom.
comment: James Franck and Gustav Hertz received their Nobel Prize one year later, in 1926.

name: Karl Manne Georg Siegbahn
affiliation: Uppsala University, Uppsala, Sweden
motivation: for his discoveries and research in the field of X-ray spectroscopy.
comment: Manne Siegbahn received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1925.

name: Robert Andrews Millikan
affiliation: California Institute of Technology (Caltech), Pasadena, CA, USA
motivation: for his work on the elementary charge of electricity and on the photoelectric effect.

name: Niels Henrik David Bohr
affiliation: Copenhagen University, Copenhagen, Denmark
motivation: for his services in the investigation of the structure of atoms and of the radiation emanating from them.

name: Albert Einstein
affiliation: Kaiser-Wilhelm-Institut (now Max-Planck-Institut) für Physik, Berlin, Germany
motivation: for his services to Theoretical Physics, and especially for his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect.
comment: Albert Einstein received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1922.

name: Charles Edouard Guillaume
affiliation: Bureau International des Poids et Mesures (International Bureau of Weights and Measures), Sèvres, France
motivation: in recognition of the service he has rendered to precision measurements in Physics by his discovery of anomalies in nickel steel alloys.

name: Johannes Stark
affiliation: Greifswald University, Greifswald, Germany
motivation: for his discovery of the Doppler effect in canal rays and the splitting of spectral lines in electric fields.

name: Max Karl Ernst Ludwig Planck
affiliation: Berlin University, Berlin, Germany
motivation: in recognition of the services he rendered to the advancement of Physics by his discovery of energy quanta.
comment: Max Planck received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1919.

name: Charles Glover Barkla
affiliation: Edinburgh University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
motivation: for his discovery of the characteristic Röntgen radiation of the elements.
comment: Charles Glover Barkla received his Nobel Prize one year later, in 1918.

name: Sir William Henry Bragg
affiliation: University College, London, United Kingdom
motivation: for their services in the analysis of crystal structure by means of X-rays.

name: William Lawrence Bragg
affiliation: Victoria University, Manchester, United Kingdom
motivation: for their services in the analysis of crystal structure by means of X-rays.

name: Max von Laue
affiliation: Frankfurt-on-the-Main University, Frankfurt-on-the-Main, Germany
motivation: for his discovery of the diffraction of X-rays by crystals.

name: Heike Kamerlingh Onnes
affiliation: Leiden University, Leiden, the Netherlands
motivation: for his investigations on the properties of matter at low temperatures which led, inter alia, to the production of liquid helium.

name: Nils Gustaf Dalén
affiliation: Swedish Gas-Accumulator Co., Lidingö-Stockholm, Sweden
motivation: for his invention of automatic regulators for use in conjunction with gas accumulators for illuminating lighthouses and buoys.

name: Wilhelm Wien
affiliation: Würzburg University, Würzburg, Germany
motivation: for his discoveries regarding the laws governing the radiation of heat.

name: Johannes Diderik van der Waals
affiliation: Amsterdam University, Amsterdam, the Netherlands
motivation: for his work on the equation of state for gases and liquids.

name: Guglielmo Marconi
affiliation: Marconi Wireless Telegraph Co. Ltd., London, United Kingdom
motivation: in recognition of their contributions to the development of wireless telegraphy.

name: Karl Ferdinand Braun
affiliation: Strasbourg University, Strasbourg, Alsace (then Germany, now France)
motivation: in recognition of their contributions to the development of wireless telegraphy.

name: Gabriel Lippmann
affiliation: Sorbonne University, Paris, France
motivation: for his method of reproducing colours photographically based on the phenomenon of interference.

name: Albert Abraham Michelson
affiliation: University of Chicago, Chicago, IL, USA
motivation: for his optical precision instruments and the spectroscopic and metrological investigations carried out with their aid.

name: Joseph John Thomson
birth_place: Cheetham Hill, near Manchester, United Kingdom
affiliation: University of Cambridge, Cambridge, United Kingdom
motivation: in recognition of the great merits of his theoretical and experimental investigations on the conduction of electricity by gases.

name: Philipp Eduard Anton von Lenard
death_place: Messelhausen, Germany (now Alsace (then Germany, now France))
affiliation: Kiel University, Kiel, Germany
motivation: for his work on cathode rays.

name: Lord Rayleigh (John William Strutt)
birth_place: Langford Grove, Maldon, Essex, United Kingdom
affiliation: Royal Institution of Great Britain, London, United Kingdom
motivation: for his investigations of the densities of the most important gases and for his discovery of argon in connection with these studies.

name: Antoine Henri Becquerel
affiliation: École Polytechnique, Paris, France
motivation: in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered by his discovery of spontaneous radioactivity.

name: Pierre Curie
affiliation: École municipale de physique et de chimie industrielles (Municipal School of Industrial Physics and Chemistry), Paris, France
motivation: in recognition of the extraordinary services they have rendered by their joint researches on the radiation phenomena discovered by Professor Henri Becquerel.

name: Marie Curie, née Sklodowska
affiliation: in recognition of the extraordinary services they have rendered by their joint researches on the radiation phenomena discovered by Professor Henri Becquerel.

name: Hendrik Antoon Lorentz
affiliation: Leiden University, Leiden, the Netherlands
motivation: in recognition of the extraordinary service they rendered by their researches into the influence of magnetism upon radiation phenomena.

name: Pieter Zeeman
affiliation: Amsterdam University, Amsterdam, the Netherlands
motivation: in recognition of the extraordinary service they rendered by their researches into the influence of magnetism upon radiation phenomena.

name: Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen
affiliation: Munich University, Munich, Germany
motivation: in recognition of the extraordinary services he has rendered by the discovery of the remarkable rays subsequently named after him.
